Uses of Class
frontend.controlP5.Accordion

Packages that use Accordion 
Package Description
frontend.controlP5
ControlP5

  • Uses of Accordion in frontend.controlP5

    Methods in frontend.controlP5 that return Accordion 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Accordion ControlP5Base.addAccordion​(java.lang.Object theObject, java.lang.String theName)  
    Accordion ControlP5Base.addAccordion​(java.lang.String theName)  
    Accordion ControlP5Legacy.addAccordion​(java.lang.Object theObject, java.lang.String theIndex, java.lang.String theName)  
    Accordion ControlP5Legacy.addAccordion​(java.lang.String theName, int theX, int theY, int theWidth)  
    Accordion Accordion.addItem​(ControlGroup<?> theGroup)
    Adds items of type ControlGroup to the Accordion, only ControlGroups can be added.
    Accordion Accordion.close()  
    Accordion Accordion.close​(int... theId)  
    Accordion Accordion.open()  
    Accordion Accordion.open​(int... theId)  
    Accordion Accordion.remove​(ControllerInterface<?> theGroup)
    Removes a ControlGroup from the accordion AND from controlP5 remove(ControllerInterface theGroup) overwrites it's super method.
    Accordion Accordion.removeItem​(ControlGroup<?> theGroup)
    Removes a ControlGroup from the accordion and puts it back into the default tab of controlP5.
    Accordion Accordion.setCollapseMode​(int theMode)  
    Accordion Accordion.setItemHeight​(int theHeight)  
    Accordion Accordion.setMinItemHeight​(int theHeight)
    Sets the minimum height of a collapsed item, default value is 100.
    Accordion Accordion.setWidth​(int theWidth)  
    Accordion Accordion.updateItems()
    UpdateItems is called when changes such as remove, change of height is performed on an accordion.
